TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit VScrollBar extends System.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar

Docs.summary: Represents a standard Windows vertical scroll bar.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Most controls that need scroll bars already provide them and do not require this control. This is true of a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control, a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox>, and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox>, for example.
You can use this control to implement scrolling in containers that do not provide their own scroll bars such as a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PictureBox> or for user input of numeric data. The numeric data can be displayed in a control or used in code. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.Minimum%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.Maximum%2A> properties determine the range of values the user can select. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.LargeChange%2A> property determines the effect of clicking within the scroll bar but outside the scroll box. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.SmallChange%2A> property determines the effect of clicking the scroll arrows at each end of the control.
## Examples The following example creates and initializes a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VScrollBar> and adds it to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>.
[!code-cpp[Classic VScrollBar Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic VScrollBar Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic VScrollBar Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic VScrollBar Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic VScrollBar Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic VScrollBar Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets the default size of the control.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Windows.Forms.RightToLeft RightToLeft { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether control's elements are aligned to support locales using right-to-left fonts.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VScrollBar.RightToLeft%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VScrollBar> control cannot be set.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the value of the property changes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VScrollBar.RightToLeft%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VScrollBar> control cannot be set, so the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VScrollBar> never raises the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VScrollBar.RightToLeftChanged> event.
